data.title: Antigua Guatemala
data.text: Antigua Guatemala commonly known as Antigua or La Antigua is a city in the central highlands of Guatemala The city was the capital of the Captaincy General of Guatemala from 1543 through 1773 with much of its Baroque influenced architecture and layout dating from that period These characteristics had it designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1979 Antigua Guatemala serves as the capital of the homonymous municipality and the Sacatepquez Department Population The city had a peak population of some 65 000 in the 1770s the bulk of the population moved away in the late 18th century Despite significant population growth in the late 20th century the city had only reached half that number by the 1990s At the time of the 2007 census the city had 34 685 inhabitants
